quote_first:

“There has been a bad business during the night at 3, Lauriston Gardens, off the Brixton Road. Our man on the beat saw a light there about
quote_last: , and as the house was an empty one, suspected that something was amiss.”
title: A Study in Scarlet

quote_first: When I came home to West Egg that night I was afraid for a moment that my house was on fire.
quote_last: and the whole corner of the peninsula was blazing with light, which fell unreal on the shrubbery and made thin elongating glints upon the roadside wires.
title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote_last: back at the Weatherbys’ Sally asked her if she and Amory had had a “time” in the den. Isabelle turned to her quietly. In her eyes was the light of the idealist, the inviolate dreamer of Joan-like dreams.
title: This Side of Paradise

title: Les Misérables

quote_first: Lady Macbeth: Out, damned spot; out, I say. One,
quote_last: ,—why, then ’tis time to do’t. Hell is murky. Fie, my lord, fie, a soldier and afeard? What need we fear who knows it when none can call our power to account? Yet who would have thought the old man to have had so much blood in him?
title: Macbeth
author: William Shakespeare

quote_first: Somewhere behind a screen a clock began wheezing, as though oppressed by something, as though someone were strangling it. After an unnaturally prolonged wheezing there followed a shrill, nasty, and as it were unexpectedly rapid, chime - as though someone were suddenly jumping forward.
quote_last: I woke up, though I had indeed not been asleep but lying half-conscious.
title: Notes from the Underground
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote_first: When all had grown quiet and Fyodor Pavlovich went to bed at around
quote_last: , Ivan Fyodorovich also went to bed with the firm resolve of falling quickly asleep, as he felt horribly exhausted.
title: The Brothers Karamazov
